result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henrietta Reliford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henrietta Reliford in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Henrietta Reliford.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant motion to dismiss case. Arguments heard. Court denies motion to dismiss. Defendant may be considering an NGI plea. Court holds colloquy with the defendant, adjourned matter for a status conference to determine case posture. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Henrietta Reliford appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Henrietta Reliford.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #02CF503. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Gleesing.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Henrietta Reliford in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a prelimnary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Henrietta Reliford in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present; not served and is off today. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 28, 2022 - received

Defendant Henrietta Reliford in court, appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 6, 2022 - received

Court ordered no contact with Martin L.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Henrietta Reliford in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Henrietta Reliford in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Henrietta Reliford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
